intro: Nardurus tenuiflorus, commonly known as the slender-flowered nardus, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. This perennial herb is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that appear in dense clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The plant plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
